FuncDef:
The qos deficit-unit command sets the module scheduling granularity.
The undo qos deficit-unit command cancels the configuration of module scheduling granularity.
By default,the chip scheduling granularity is not set.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the module scheduling granularity as 1k.
-

Sets the module scheduling granularity as 2k.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the module scheduling granularity to 1k or 2k bytes, run the qos deficit-unit command.
Precautions
After this command is run on an empty trunk interface and a GE interface is added to a trunk interface, the undo qos deficit-unit command cannot be run on the trunk interface.
After a GE interface is added to a trunk interface, this command cannot be configured on the GE interface.
Only the trunk interfaces that have no member interfaces support this command.
After this command is configured on a GE interface, the GE interface cannot be added to any trunk interface.
Configuring scheduling granularity on an interface affects traffic forwarding on the interface for a short period of time.
Adjusting the scheduling granularity of an interface affects the forwarding performance of the board. The performance deterioration ratio is related to the default scheduling granularity of the board. For example, if the default scheduling granularity of a board is 2K, the forwarding performance decreases by about 50% after the scheduling granularity is set to 1K. In addition, when the scheduling granularity is adjusted, traffic is interrupted for a short period of time.
If the qos-profile, user-queue, or bas command is configured on an interface, the qos deficit-unit command cannot be configured on the interface.
